subsidy_notes: National distributed PV subsidy at 0.03 CNY/kWh; provincial top-up may apply. Self-consumption prioritised.
notes: Feed-in tariff at grid parity. Self-consumption model preferred.

subsidy_notes: Bureau of Energy feed-in tariff for rooftop PV < 20 kW: ~5.7 TWD/kWh (2024).
notes: Strong government push for rooftop solar. Guaranteed 20-year FIT.

subsidy_notes: Federal ITC 30% through 2032. California SGIP and other state incentives may apply. NEM 3.0 export rates vary by TOU.
notes: NEM 3.0 significantly reduced export compensation vs NEM 2.0. Battery pairing recommended.

subsidy_notes: Federal Greener Homes Grant up to $5,000 CAD for solar. Ontario net metering programme available.
notes: Time-of-use rates. Net metering credits roll over for 12 months.

subsidy_notes: No direct residential subsidy currently. Low electricity prices reduce economic incentive for small systems.
notes: Net metering framework in place since 2017. Tiered tariff structure.

subsidy_notes: Superbonus 70% tax deduction for building renovation including PV (2024). GSE Scambio sul Posto for < 500 kW.
notes: High electricity prices make rooftop PV very attractive. Superbonus is key driver.

subsidy_notes: Net billing law allows systems up to 300 kW. Small-scale subsidies through Casa Solar programme.
notes: Export compensated at regulated energy price. Excellent solar resource.

subsidy_notes: National DG law enables net metering. No direct subsidy currently; economic volatility affects planning.
notes: Tariff instability due to inflation. Net metering credits at injection price.

subsidy_notes: Superbonus tax deduction available. Heritage zone restrictions may limit rooftop installations.
notes: Historic centre has severe restrictions on rooftop modifications. Outer islands may be eligible.

subsidy_notes: Federal ITC 30%. NY-Sun incentive: ~$0.20/W for residential. VDER (Value of DER) for larger systems.
notes: Strong state support. Community solar programmes available. Con Edison territory.

compensation_regime: Net Metering + PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana
subsidy_notes: Central Govt subsidy: ₹30,000/kW for first 2 kW, ₹78,000 for 3+ kW (cap). State Govt subsidy: ₹15,000 for 1 kW, ₹30,000 for 2+ kW. Total subsidy up to ₹1,08,000.
notes: PM Surya Ghar scheme provides subsidised rooftop solar for residential consumers. MSEDCL net metering available.
